title: Kristallnacht
notable_figures: Adolf Hitler, Joseph Goebbels, Hermann Göring
visuals: burning synagogues; smashed shop windows; Nazi soldiers; Jewish civilians in distress; debris on the streets
prompt: A highly detailed, photo-realistic image of Kristallnacht as it might have appeared at the time. The scene includes burning synagogues, smashed shop windows, Nazi soldiers, Jewish civilians in distress, and debris on the streets, depicted with authentic clothing, environment, and technology from the historical era. Captured as if by a high-resolution camera. No text or modern artifacts. Realistic proportions, cinematic style.
caption: Kristallnacht, or the Night of Broken Glass, was a pogrom against Jews carried out by the Nazi regime on November 9-10, 1938, resulting in widespread destruction of Jewish property and synagogues across Germany.

title: Publication of 'De revolutionibus orbium coelestium'
visuals: a scholar in Renaissance attire; a wooden desk with manuscripts; an astrolabe; a globe; a window showing a medieval European cityscape
prompt: A highly detailed, photo-realistic image of Publication of 'De revolutionibus orbium coelestium' as it might have appeared at the time. The scene includes a scholar in Renaissance attire, a wooden desk with manuscripts, an astrolabe, a globe, and a window showing a medieval European cityscape, depicted with authentic clothing, environment, and technology from the historical era. Captured as if by a high-resolution camera. No text or modern artifacts. Realistic proportions, cinematic style.
caption: 'De revolutionibus orbium coelestium', published in 1543, marked a pivotal moment in the Scientific Revolution, introducing the heliocentric model of the universe proposed by Nicolaus Copernicus.
